page.title: 05 St.Marys Church - General
page.content: {St.Marys Church}in Eastham is about 800 years old. It has been in existence since around 1150. The oldest part of the church is the { {Stanley Chapel}and the newest part is the {Bapistry}which was built between the 17th and 18th century. The church steeple is about 35 metres high. It is called a {Brooch {Steeple}because it is mounted on top of a tower. The{Belfry}has 6 bells; they were originally cast in the 18th century. The{Font}in the bapistry is said to be half Saxon and half Roman. They say that the top half is a Saxon font from the original{'Wattle and Daub'}church and the bottom half is said to be a Roman Pillar.A brass jug in the bapistry is filled with water and blessed by the vicar.It is then poured into the font and the baby is baptised
